desc.en: The New York City Subway is a rapid transit system in New York City, serving four of the city's five boroughs: Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens, and the Bronx. Opened on October 27, 1904, the New York City Subway is one of the world's oldest public transit systems, one of the most-used, and the one with the second-most stations after the Beijing Subway, with 472 stations in operation (423, if stations connected by transfers are counted as single stations). Overall, the system consists of 248 miles (399 km) of routes, comprising a total of 665 miles (1,070 km) of revenue track and a total of 850 miles (1,370 km) including non-revenue trackage.
